sources.title: Crashin' Broadway (1933) REX BELLüçï COWBOY WESTERN
sources.description:
Starring: Rex Bell, Doris Hill, Harry Bowen, George  "Gabby" Hayes
Director: John P. McCarthy

After his western act flops on Broadway, a cowboy heads west and joins a new traveling troupe in a quiet town. But peace is short-lived‚Äîwhen a gangster burns down the local theater, our cowboy hero hatches a clever plan. With the help of a Shakespearean actor, he sets a trap to bring justice to the outlaw in authentic western style.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

This is a must-watch if you're a fan of classic westerns, Rex Bell movies, Doris Hill‚Äôs screen presence, Harry Bowen‚Äôs comedy, or Gabby Hayes' iconic roles! ‚ÄúCrashin‚Äô Broadway‚Äù blends drama, action, and that timeless cowboy spirit that defined 1930s western cinema.

metadata.Plot: When Tad Wallace's act flops on Broadway, he joins a troop heading west. In a small town they run into Jeffries who has just burned down the theater. When Jeffries kills Griswold, Tad has a plan to trap him by using the talents of Shakespearian actor Thorndyke.
metadata.Actors: Rex Bell, Doris Hill, Harry Bowen
